00010 "Conferts a position vector image to normals"
00011 "by crossing the image gradients in X Y and Z"

00056 joGradVec::joGradVec() : Iop() 
00057 {

00072         Bool_knob( f, &flipY, "FLIP Y\n" );
00073         Bool_knob( f, &flipZ, "FLIP Z\n" );

00082 void joGradVec::_validate(bool for_real)
00083 {
00084         copy_info();
00085 
00086         set_out_channels( Mask_All );
00087         
00088 
00089         info_.set( info_.x(), info_.y(), info_.r() + 2, info_.t() + 2 );
00090         Format temp = info_.format();
00091         width = temp.width();
00092 
00093 }

00095 void joGradVec::_request(int x,int y,int r,int t, ChannelMask channels, int count)
00096 {
00097         input0().request(x,y,r+1,t+1, channels, count);

00100 void joGradVec::engine(int y, int x, int r, ChannelMask channels, Row& out)
00101 {
00103         out.range( 0, width );
00105         Row in1(x, r);
00106         Row in2(x, r);
00107 
00108 
00109         input0().get(y, x, r, channels, in1);
00110         input0().get(y + 1, x, r, channels, in2);
00111 
00112 
00113         float flipperX = 1.0f;
00114         float flipperY = 1.0f;
00115         float flipperZ = 1.0f;
00116         if( flipX )
00117                 flipperX = -1.0f;
00118         if( flipY )
00119                 flipperY = -1.0f;
00120         if( flipZ )
00121                 flipperZ = -1.0f;
00123         foreach (z, channels) 
00124         {
00126                 float* outPixelsR = out.writable(Chan_Red);
00127                 float* outPixelsG = out.writable(Chan_Green);
00128                 float* outPixelsB = out.writable(Chan_Blue);
00130                 for (int index = x; index < r; index++ ) 
00131                 {
00133                         float X1 = in1[Chan_Red][index + 1];
00134                         float C0 = in1[Chan_Red][index];
00135                         float Y1 = in2[Chan_Red][index];
00137                         float vecX = X1 - C0;
00138                         float vecY = Y1 - C0;
00140                         Vector result( -vecX, -vecY, 0.0f );
00142                         if ( result.length() != 0 )
00143                                 result.normalize();
00145                         result.x = result.x * flipperX;
00146                         result.y = result.y * flipperY;
00147                         result.z = result.z * flipperZ;
00148 
00149                         outPixelsR[index] = result.x;
00150                         outPixelsG[index] = result.y;
00151                         outPixelsB[index] = result.z;
00152                 }
00153         }
00154 
00155 }
